meanings.definition: A furnace or apparatus used for burning waste materials.
meanings.sent1: The incinerator at the recycling plant burns all the paper waste.
meanings.sent2: The city installed a new incinerator to dispose of garbage more efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The incinerator seemed to have a fiery appetite for all the trash thrown into it.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like an incinerator, consuming everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The incinerator roared to life, devouring the old furniture with ease.

meanings.definition: One that incinerates, especially a furnace for burning refuse.
meanings.sent1: The janitor was the incinerator of all the confidential documents.
meanings.sent2: The incinerator in the backyard was used to burn fallen leaves.
meanings.sent3: The incinerator in the kitchen was nicknamed 'Flamey' by the staff.
meanings.sent4: His words were like an incinerator, destroying her self-confidence.
meanings.sent5: The incinerator belched smoke as it worked tirelessly to dispose of the waste.
